filmography.title: True Grit
filmography.role_description: A drunken, hard-nosed U.S. Marshal who is hired by a tenacious teenage girl to track down her father's murderer.
filmography.plot: A U.S. Marshal and a Texas Ranger help a stubborn teenager track down her father's murderer in Indian territory.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor (Drama)

filmography.title: The Searchers
filmography.role_description: A bitter, racist Civil War veteran who spends years relentlessly searching for his niece who was abducted by Comanches.
filmography.plot: An American Civil War veteran embarks on a years-long journey to rescue his niece from the Comanches after the rest of his brother's family is massacred.

filmography.title: Stagecoach
filmography.role_description: A notorious outlaw who escapes prison and joins a stagecoach journey, seeking revenge on the men who framed him.
filmography.plot: A group of people traveling on a stagecoach find their journey complicated by the threat of Geronimo and learn something about each other in the process.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actor (Thomas Mitchell)

filmography.title: The Quiet Man
filmography.role_description: A retired American boxer who returns to the village of his birth in Ireland to find peace and a wife.
filmography.plot: A retired American boxer returns to the village of his birth in Ireland, where he finds love and conflict.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Director; Oscar: Nomination – Best Picture

filmography.title: Red River
filmography.role_description: A tyrannical cattle baron who drives his herd north on the Chisholm Trail, alienating his adopted son with his harsh methods.
filmography.plot: A rancher's authoritarian ways lead to a mutiny on a cattle drive to Missouri.

filmography.title: Rio Bravo
filmography.role_description: A small-town sheriff who enlists the help of a 'cripple,' a drunk, and a young gunfighter to keep a local bad guy in jail.
filmography.plot: A small-town sheriff in the American West enlists the help of a disabled man, a drunk, and a young gunfighter to hold in jail the brother of the local bad guy.

filmography.title: The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance
filmography.role_description: A tough, self-sufficient rancher who steps aside to let a lawyer take credit for a heroic deed, embodying the fading Old West.
filmography.plot: A senator, who became famous for killing a notorious outlaw, returns for the funeral of an old friend and tells the truth about his deed.

filmography.title: The Alamo
filmography.role_description: The legendary frontiersman who leads a band of Tennesseans to defend the Alamo against the Mexican army.
filmography.plot: In 1836, a small band of soldiers sacrifice their lives in hopeless combat against a massive army in order to prevent a tyrant from smashing the new Republic of Texas.

filmography.title: Sands of Iwo Jima
filmography.role_description: A tough-as-nails Marine sergeant who is disliked by his men for his rigorous training but respected for his leadership in battle.
filmography.plot: A Marine sergeant is disliked by his men because of his rigorous training, but they come to respect him when they are led into battle.

filmography.title: She Wore a Yellow Ribbon
filmography.role_description: An aging cavalry officer on the verge of retirement who takes out a last patrol to stop an impending Indian attack.
filmography.plot: Captain Nathan Brittles, on the eve of retirement, takes out a last patrol to stop an impending Indian attack. Encumbered by women who must be evacuated, Brittles finds his mission imperiled.

filmography.title: The Shootist
filmography.role_description: A legendary gunfighter dying of cancer who seeks to go out with dignity in his final days; Wayne's last film role.
filmography.plot: A dying gunfighter spends his last days looking for a way to die with a minimum of pain and a maximum of dignity.

filmography.title: Fort Apache
filmography.role_description: A highly respected and experienced cavalry officer who clashes with his arrogant, glory-seeking new commander.
filmography.plot: At a remote cavalry post, a strict and arrogant commander clashes with his troops and leads them into a disastrous confrontation with the Apaches.
filmography.awards: Locarno International Film Festival: Win – Best Director

filmography.title: Rio Grande
filmography.role_description: A cavalry officer tasked with defending settlers from Apaches while dealing with the arrival of his estranged son and wife.
filmography.plot: A cavalry officer posted on the Rio Grande is faced with murderous raiding Apaches, a son who's a risk-taking recruit and his wife who wants to take their son home.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: The Longest Day
filmography.role_description: A real-life battalion commander in the 82nd Airborne Division who leads his troops on D-Day despite a broken ankle.
filmography.plot: The events of D-Day, told on a grand scale from both the Allied and German points of view.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Cinematography; Oscar: Win – Best Special Effects

filmography.title: El Dorado
filmography.role_description: A gunfighter who teams up with his old friend, a drunken sheriff, to help a rancher family fight off a rival landowner.
filmography.plot: Cole Thornton, a gunfighter for hire, joins forces with an old friend, Sheriff J.P. Hara. Together with an old Indian fighter and a gambler, they help a rancher and his family fight a rival rancher that is trying to steal their water.

filmography.title: How the West Was Won
filmography.role_description: The famous Union Civil War general who appears in a segment discussing the war with General Grant.
filmography.plot: A family saga covering several decades of Westward expansion in the 19th century, including the Gold Rush, the Civil War, and the building of the railroads.

filmography.title: Big Jake
filmography.role_description: An aging rancher who reunites with his estranged family to rescue his kidnapped grandson from a gang of outlaws.
filmography.plot: The McCandles ranch is overrun by a gang of cutthroats led by the evil John Fain. They kidnap Little Jake and demand a ransom.

filmography.title: The Cowboys
filmography.role_description: A veteran rancher who is forced to hire a group of schoolboys to help him drive his cattle herd to market.
filmography.plot: Rancher Wil Andersen is forced to hire inexperienced schoolboys as cowhands in order to get his herd to market on time.

filmography.title: McLintock!
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, self-made cattle baron who tries to manage his ranch, his headstrong daughter, and his estranged wife.
filmography.plot: Wealthy rancher G.W. McLintock uses his power and influence in the territory to keep the peace between farmers, ranchers, land-grabbers, Indians and corrupt government officials.

filmography.title: The Sons of Katie Elder
filmography.role_description: The eldest of four brothers who reunite for their mother's funeral and investigate the mysterious circumstances of their father's death.
filmography.plot: Four brothers reunite at their mother's funeral and are determined to avenge the murder of their father and the swindling of their mother's land.

filmography.title: In Harm's Way
filmography.role_description: A disgraced naval officer who is given a second chance to command a critical operation in the Pacific theater of WWII.
filmography.plot: A naval officer reprimanded after Pearl Harbor is later promoted to rear admiral and gets a second chance to prove himself against the Japanese.

filmography.title: Hondo
filmography.role_description: A cavalry dispatch rider who protects a woman and her son living in isolated Apache territory.
filmography.plot: Army dispatch rider Hondo Lane discovers a woman and her son living in the midst of warring Apaches and becomes their protector.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress (Geraldine Page)

filmography.title: 3 Godfathers
filmography.role_description: An outlaw on the run who, along with his partners, risks his freedom to care for an orphaned baby they find in the desert.
filmography.plot: Three outlaws on the run find a dying woman and her baby. They swear to bring the infant to safety across the desert, even at the risk of their own lives.

filmography.title: They Were Expendable
filmography.role_description: A PT boat commander in the Philippines during WWII who fights a losing battle against the Japanese invasion.
filmography.plot: A story of the PT Boat squadrons in the Philippines during World War II.

filmography.title: Angel and the Badman
filmography.role_description: A wounded gunfighter who is nursed back to health by a Quaker family and finds himself torn between his violent past and their peaceful life.
filmography.plot: Quirt Evans, an all-round bad guy, is nursed back to health and sought after by Penelope Worth, a Quaker girl. He eventually finds himself having to choose between his world and the world Penelope lives in.

filmography.title: Hatari!
filmography.role_description: The leader of a group of professional game catchers in Africa who trap wild animals for zoos.
filmography.plot: A group of men trap wild animals in Africa and sell them to zoos. Will the arrival of a female wildlife photographer change their ways?

filmography.title: The Green Berets
filmography.role_description: A Special Forces colonel who leads two elite units into South Vietnam to build a camp and kidnap a North Vietnamese general.
filmography.plot: Col. Mike Kirby picks two teams of crack Green Berets for a mission in South Vietnam to build and control a camp that is trying to be taken by the enemy.

filmography.title: Chisum
filmography.role_description: A powerful cattle baron in New Mexico who fights against a corrupt businessman and land grabber to protect his empire.
filmography.plot: A cattle baron takes on a corrupt businessman and his gang with the help of Billy the Kid and Pat Garrett.

filmography.title: Wake of the Red Witch
filmography.role_description: A ruthless sea captain who battles a shipping magnate over a fortune in gold and the love of a woman.
filmography.plot: In the 1860s South Pacific, a sea captain seeks revenge against a wealthy shipping tycoon.
